sentence.text: An unfractured mass of glorious red sandstone that rises one and a half kilometres up from the flat desert floor and descends four kilometres beneath it .
An iron ladder descends this accidental chasm from the nave roof , but it stops a good fifteen feet above the moss-feather-and-shit-covered earth .
Vertical pitches descend 250 feet to an immense cavern , second in dimensions only to the chamber in Gaping Gill .
Given the topography of Madeira , it is understandable that the island roads are full of twists and turns , climbing and descending all the time .
He said -- ` From Stettin in the Baltic to Trieste in the Adriatic , an iron curtain had descended across the continent of Europe " .
From the summit a path descends along Bowfell 's eastern ridge before swinging sharply south to Three Tarns Pass ( 0.5 miles ) .
It descends steadily along the line to Leicester where it joins the Soar Navigation , continuing through Leicester and Loughborough on its way to Trent Junction .
This descends alongside the ridge wall over High Pike and Low Pike and then diverges due south in a direct line down a steep slope to Bruntscar .
A fingerpost points to a short path descending amongst trees to a footbridge over the river , flowing erratically on and under its limestone bed .
The buildings which line either side of the bridge descend as far below the street as they rise above it .
Path soon descends into small bay and climbs hillock to reach Coldingham Bay ( with huts and café ) .

The road suddenly descended into a valley shaded by pines and oaks .
Keep the line of broken wire fence which descends through the wood to a gate leading onto a broad track .
The road descends to valley level in lovely birch woods and reaches a junction where the old road for Tomdoun and Kinlochhourn turns off .
Turn right , with a steep drop on the left where the path descends towards the Upper Neuadd reservoir .
The valley , as it descends towards Ribeira Brava , is probably the most beautiful in Madeira , and it has many picnic tables and pull-offs for the car .

Subduction zones , where oceanic plates descend under continental ones , and obduction zones , where spreading centres are concealed beneath sedimentary cover , are of considerable interest , not least because ophiolite sequences formed in obduction zones have given rise to economically significant concentrations of metallic minerals .

Convection currents rise and diverge below mid-oceanic ridges and converge and descend along subduction zones .
The track descends back to the start .
Before me lay a deep gulley choked with oleanders and thorny scrub , which descended precipitously down to the private beach .
